alert.note: Alert for Barron; Rusk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:31AM CST until January 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ENDING TODAY, DANGEROUSLY COLD TONIGHT INTO NEXT WEEK... .Scattered snow showers will continue today, but any accumulation will be less than an inch. Northwest wind gusts of 30 to 35 mph will lead to areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility, especially across western and southern Minnesota. Meanwhile, confidence remains high that dangerously cold wind chills will follow tonight, with widespread values of -25 to -40 likely through early next week. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western and southern Minnesota tonight through Sunday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight through Sunday morning. Looking ahead, these will likely need to be reissued again for Sunday night into Monday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Barron and Rusk Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
